Question
========
A researcher is interested in the percentage of employees in the
Netherlands who suffer from burn-out complaints. The researcher draws a
random sample of 130 Dutch employees, for which we find: p̂* = *0.12  
  
Calculate the 95% confidence interval.

Answerlist
----------
* \[0.064; 0.176\]
* \[0.099; 0.141\]
* \[0.091; 0.149\]
* \[0.118; 0.122\]

Solution
========





You can calculate this with the following formula: CI for p̂
+/-* t(se) *with *se* = (√(p̂(1 - p̂)) / n)  
  
Thus, se = (*√ *(0.12 \* (1 - 0.12)) / 130 ) = 0.0285 and CI = 0.12 +/-
1.96 \* 0.0285 = \[0.064; 0.176\]*  
*
